newsitem.title: USA: Harcourt bids for National Education.
newsitem.headline: Harcourt bids for National Education.

text.p: Harcourt General Inc said Wednesday it would launch a cash tender offer for all shares of National Education Corp at $19.50 each in a deal valued at $740 million.
Harcourt said its offer represents a premium over a rival bid by Sylvan Learning Systems Inc, which agreed on March 12 to acquire National Education for $750 million in stock.
Harcourt said that based on Sylvan's current stock price, Harcourt's cash offer represents a 15.4 percent premium.
Sylvan shares closed Tuesday at 29-1/8. National Education closed at 15. Harcourt closed at 42-7/8.

Harcourt said that if its plan to acquire National Education goes through, it will seek to acquire the outstanding shares of Steck Vaughn Publishing Corp not already owned by National Education, at $14 per share.

Harcourt, a publisher, said acquiring National Education would add new distribution channels for its products and speed its entry into several non-traditional educational high-growth markets, such as computer-based training.
Harcourt said its offer for National Education is subject to termination of the merger agreement between Sylvan and National Education.
